history.text: Hello are you there?
I am! Our movie is Despicable Me. Have you seen it?
Yeah I've seen it
Who is your favorite character?
I like Gru, hbu?
Definitely - Steve Carrell is awesome!
Yeah, he's a great actor!
It is eight years old already - dang, I feel old
It really is a long time. I can't quite remember the movie too well though
I didn't remember that Russell Brand was Dr. Nefario. I don't remember a huge amount about  it either.
Ohh......it's the movie where Gru is trying to shrink and steal the moon. Do you remember now?
Whoa! I don't remember Russell Brand voice acting a character in the movie!? So what else is interesting about the movie?
Not quite well. All I remember is that there's alot of minions.
I love them lol.....and so do my nieces. Jason Segel was the voice of Mr. Perkins - the Evil bank president.
That's who Gru has to get the loan from so he can buy the shrink ray.
I need to watch this movie again lol
Haha, I know. I think I remember that scene where Gru talks to Mr. Perkins about him getting a loan
I need to rewatch this again. lol
Remember the scene when he took the girls to the park? There is such a sweetness to this movie.
The story is by Sergio Pablos - I am going to look him up to see if he has any books for kids.
Gru wasn't really amused though because of his personality, but he was still kind enough to take the kids.
Sergio Pablos? Who is he?
Apparently, he wrote the story.
It got ratings from Rotten Tomatoes of 81 percent and average 6.8/10. That seems kind of low, but I am not sure what their criteria is.
That just shows people don't look at the directors or writers of book/movie

Agreed. Unless they are celebrities .
Do you watch a lot of animated movies?

I agree that's really low rating for an animated
 movies
Yes I do
Have you seen the second Despicable?
No I haven't actually watch the second and the third.
This also got a rating from Metacritic of 72/100. I don't agree with them, either. Who are these people??
I have seen the second, but not the third one yet either.
Not sure. I know that they probably don't like animated movies or just very analytical about little things

Does it say/show
 why it's rated very low?
Or maybe they are jaded by Hollywood. No, it gave no reasons - just three listings. Rotten Tomatoes, Metacritic, and CinemaScore, which was an A.
Maybe the CinemaScore was from people who had seen it in the theatre.
Plus, the ratings were from before the francise blew up and minions were everywhere :)
I assume too as well. But I wonder why it was really low 72/100. Does that mean I shouldn't watch the second one then?? :/
I know the minions makes it better! I love how hilarious the movie is, especially the kids making fun of Gru.
It means the opposite  - the second was so funny! I don't pay attention to critics much.

uid2response.feedback: The ratings of the movie seem pretty below average, but I think I should watch it since the first Despicable Me was entertaining which makes the second a good movie.
